description: It had one job, which is the core idea of the whole application: the drop-down terminal. And that is the very thing it fails at.

In my Gnome terminal, zsh is set and working. With terminus, for some reason it defaulted to bash. When I started zsh, the look of p10k was bad.

Can't recommend
Using lnav to monitor my syslogs. Needed to create a new terminal to repair hostnames and upon creating a split term, lnav crashed. Going back to something I know.
summary: Resizing or creating splits causes some processes to crash

description: No transparency, hardly any customization options at all, has an ugly red bar at the top of dropdown terminal for some reason.
summary: A very poor substitute for guake

description: There doesn't appear to be a way to scale the text size with the window, nor adjust it which is a manditory feature for me on this high resolution display
summary: Very basic app, missing many features I would consider manditory

description:
Its like gnome Termial but slightly better, it has split view, guake-mode. As for performance, I checked it uses the same amount of resources, but fells more responsible.
As for downsides, built-in color schemes are bad.
summary: Very lightweight and useful terminal. It suits my casual needs 100%

description: Terminus is an awesome terminal emulator, but under my Ubuntu 20.10 it keeps disappearing from my installed programs after several reboots and I haven't figured out why that is.
Crash all time after 2h of use...
